data.title: GuitHealthBarHud flip fill
data.body: This adds the option for the GuiHealthBarHud to fill the other way.

data.title: After delete SimObject, the memory is still not free all.
Shadow cascades shrink when zooming
data.body:
When you zoom and look at the distance you sometimes can see shadows disappearing, this is because zooming manipulates FOV by reducing it, but this also makes the shadow cascades become smaller.
This can lead to being able to see shadows disappearing, if you zoom into something that casts shadows from a certain distance or areas where the shadows cut off if you look close.
Here is an example, I'm zooming on distant trees and you can see the shadows cutting off in a straight line, which can be a bit ugly:
http://duion.com/files/temp/t3d_zoombug.jpg

data.title: Fix redundant memcpy in swizzle ToBuffer method
data.body: In this case, memcpy is redundant as the data is copied according to the copy loop in the next block.

data.title: Reduce the amount of blocks of memory DataChunker uses
data.body:
This reduces the amount of memory allocations DataChunker uses.

In addition this also fixes a bug where "next" was not cleared when blocks were free'd.

data.title: MacOS platform support
data.body:
Support for 64bit macOS platform. Minimum requirement is macOS 10.9.

Port originally based off the excellent work done by @JeffProgrammer and mixed in with some code from out little brother Torque2D.

*Retina displays are currently unsupported as i didn't have access to retina display and i'm not keen on committing untested code. The retina display will work, however the resolutions will be incorrect.  SDL2 does have retina support, so it's just a matter of finding a user with a retina display who can test some code for us before committing it.

data.title: Gui speedometer hud
data.body:
This patch fixes several bugs in guiSpeedometerHud::onRender():

-Caused hard crash due to unmatched pushWorldMatrix() call.
-Routine did not rotate/translate the control, causing render to fail in all cases.
-Control would not render for player-mounted vehicles (i.e. when used in a fps context) .

data.title: Wrong bump in shader waterP.hlsl (and probably .glsl too)
Fixes AbstractPolyList::addBox(). Complete each face with missing 2nd triangle.
data.body:
Hi all,

This is a minefield, which is a class inherited from Trigger. 
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2324012/18708571/d9a0f9d2-7ffb-11e6-9e55-efdcec2d3ce9.png)

Ok, and because Military intelligence should work, enemies (Tanks) must avoid go across it, because it's his own minefield! Then I added the minefield to NavMesh. Then I realized that I had to add a buildPolyList function to my class, which uses AbstractPolyList::addBox().

And as you can see, the edges of  the box is not completely etched from the NavMesh.
Looking at AbstractPolyList::addBox() I saw that only add one triangle per face, so I fix it and that the result:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2324012/18708845/330a837a-7ffd-11e6-8fc5-521ec8fb1d08.png)

With this PR it's added the second triangle to the face, but I can't say If this was originally made by design, or if breaks something else...

data.title: TSShapeInstance::getDuration(TSThread*)  Segfault
data.body: Happens seemingly randomly and may be because I've assigned an animationless model to an AIPlayer (a double-sided plane as a 3d sprite).

data.title: Decals and Decalroads with transparency don't apply normalmaps
data.body: When using decals and decalroads that have transparency flag set in their materialdefinition don't apply their normalmaps when rendered. Setting or clearingthe Transparent Z-write flag has no influence.

data.title: embeds blendtotal into the low bit for the normal|depth buffer
data.body:
for terrains to support multi-pass blending. 

Do note this will only address https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/issues/1701 . Comprable blending artifacts for normals on objects with multiple layers with the normal maps on layer 0 and subsequent layers lacking a normal will need to be addressed separately.

data.title: GuiInspector's findByObject method fix.
data.body: Renames the engine method arg to avoid name confusion.

data.title: Fix crash when saving NavMesh file without Links
data.body: Write Links only when mLinkIDs.size() > 0

data.title: Fixes up some SDL splash screen issues.
data.body:
Disables the splash image when using MacOS for now, as the startup forces a OGL 2.1 context, which is causing problems.

Also adds a sanity check in the event a splash image isn't found.

data.title: Makes sure the key modifiers are passed along with mouse actions.
data.body: Makes sure the key modifiers are passed along with mouse move and wheel inputs when using SDL.

data.title: Fixes the Toggle Children Lock and Toggle Children Hidden options
data.body: Fixes the Toggle Children Lock and Toggle Children Hidden options in the editor context popup menu.

data.title: Added a missed a preprocessor for when not using openVR.
Add the ability to compile the engine as a DLL.
data.body:
You will have to use this PR in conjunction with #1766 if you intend to use OpenGL on windows. The reason is Epoxy has a DLLmain method in it. See the issue listed above for more information.

This PR simply adds an option in cmake called TORQUE_SHARED so that you can compile the engine as a DLL and have a "stub" exe, just like the project generator allowed.

_Do not merge in until 1766 is merged._

data.title: Replace Epoxy with Glad
data.body:
Sorry folks. Looks like epoxy is turning out to be a lemon.

1) epoxy isn't really maintained anymore.
2) epoxy as we know had trouble with VS2015 and we are thus compiling it with optimizations turned off in release.

And now we get a number 3!

3) So, I was adding support back into Torque 3D so that you can compile the engine as a DLL using CMake. It turns out epoxy defines its own DLLMain method, making it impossible to statically link into another DLL unless you modify the library itself. 

Timmy suggested we use Glad, and we both have used it in the past. It is super simple to use. The glad generator is the OpenGL 4.5 core profile + all of the extensions that are usable in the core profile. WGL and GLX are also added.

If we could have a Linux tester be so kind to let me know if the GLX portion is working (do we even need that since we use SDL) that would be great.

As they say, three strikes and you are out...

data.title: Correctly copy mipmap sub resources for DX11 cubemap.
data.body: Fixes #1748

data.body: so it falls within the same scale system as ambient and the like
